article.headline: Colgate-Palmolive Co. stock rises Friday, outperforms market
article.body: Shares of Colgate-Palmolive Co. CL, +1.30% rose 1.31% to $79.77 Friday, on what proved to be an all-around positive trading session for the stock market, with the S&P 500 Index SPX, +0.87% rising 0.88% to 3,477.14 and the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.56% rising 0.57% to 28,586.90. This was the stock's third consecutive day of gains. Colgate-Palmolive Co. closed $0.33 below its 52-week high ($80.09), which the company achieved on September 3rd. The stock demonstrated a mixed performance when compared to some of its competitors Friday, as Procter & Gamble Co. PG, +0.89% rose 0.90% to $142.92, Unilever PLC ADR UL, +1.44% rose 1.45% to $63.12, and Reckitt Benckiser Group PLC RBGPF, +0.93% rose 0.94% to $97.46. Trading volume (2.9 M) remained 159,436 below its 50-day average volume of 3.0 M. Editor's Note: This story was auto-generated by Automated Insights using data from Dow Jones and FactSet. See our market data terms of use.
